東アジア首脳会議で安倍首相、北ミサイル発射を非難

04 Nov 2019, 12:32



東アジア首脳会議（ＥＡＳ）に臨む安倍首相（中央）。手前右は韓国の文在寅大統領（４日午後１時５８分、バンコクで）＝片岡航希撮影

　【バンコク＝池田慶太、田中洋一郎】日米中露や東南アジア諸国連合（ＡＳＥＡＮ）など１８か国首脳が参加する東アジア首脳会議（ＥＡＳ）が４日、バンコクで開かれた。安倍首相は北朝鮮の相次ぐ弾道ミサイル発射を非難し、南シナ海問題については国際法に基づく平和的解決を求めた。
　首相はミサイル発射について、「国連安全保障理事会決議の明白な違反だ」と述べた。その上で、北朝鮮の非核化に向けた米朝協議を支持する日本の立場を説明し、「国際社会が一体となって米朝プロセスを後押ししていくことが重要だ」と呼びかけた。首相同行筋によると、多くの首脳が対話を通じた平和的解決の重要性に言及した。
　中国が軍事拠点化を進める南シナ海の問題については、首相は中国の名指しは避けつつ、「あらゆる一方的な現状変更の試みや、他国に対する威圧に強く反対する」と強調した。
　ＥＡＳには中国の李克強（リークォーチャン）首相やロシアのメドベージェフ首相らも出席したが、米国はオブライエン国家安全保障担当大統領補佐官を特使として派遣した。２日始まったＡＳＥＡＮ関連の首脳会議は、一連の日程を終えて４日夜に閉幕した。

Prime Minister Abe accused of launching North missile at East Asia Summit

04 Nov 2019, 12:32



Prime Minister Abe (center) at the East Asia Summit (EAS). The foreground is the Korean President Moon Wen-in (1:58 p.m., Bangkok, 4th day)

[Bangkok = Keita Ikeda, Yoichiro Tanaka] The East Asia Summit (EAS) was held in Bangkok on the 4th, with 18 leaders from Japan, the US, China and Russia, and the Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN). Prime Minister Abe accused North Korea of launching successive ballistic missiles and called for a peaceful solution based on international law for the South China Sea issue.
“The Prime Minister said that the missile launch was an obvious violation of the UN Security Council resolution.” On that basis, he explained Japan's position in support of the US-North Korea talks toward the denuclearization of North Korea, and called it "it is important for the international community to unitely support the US-North Korean process." According to Neck Homogeneous Sources, many leaders have mentioned the importance of peaceful resolution through dialogue.
-Regarding the issue of the South China Sea, where China is becoming a military base, the Prime Minister emphasized that he strongly opposes all unilateral attempts to change the status quo and intimidation against other countries, while avoiding the designation of China.
Primarily, China's Prime Minister Lee Kwaqiang and Russia's Prime Minister Medvedev attended the EAS, but the United States dispatched Obrien's Presidential Secretary of State Security as a special envoy. The ASEAN-related summit meeting that started on the 2nd ended with a series of dates and ended on the evening of the 4th.
